byline.original: By JOHN FOLEY, EDWARD HADAS and MARTIN HUTCHINSON

abstract: Reuters BreakingViews column observes China's efforts to please banks, business and citizens all at once have eroded trust and credibility; compares Occupy Wall Street protesters to Jacob Coxey's 1894 march on Washington following period of economic turmoil.
snippet: Unlike a similar move three years ago, a plan to buy bank shares does little to stimulate the market.
lead_paragraph: Unlike a similar move three years ago, a plan to buy bank shares does little to stimulate the market.

headline.main: Investors’ Trust in China’s Government Falters
headline.print_headline: Credibility Takes A Hit in China
headline.seo: Investors’ Trust in China’s Government Falters
